content: Radical Islam, Middle East Turmoil, and United States Led Imperialism Is radical Islam the cause or is it a consequence of a larger problem? Daniel Goldman Blocked Unblock Follow Following Apr 19 Photo by Jordy Meow on  Unsplash Radical Islam has caused significant harm to the world. The worst terrorist organizations in the world are radical terrorist groups like the Taliban, Al Qaeda, ISIS, and so many others. They are responsible for countless lives being lost. Sorry, that’s actually the United States and allied forces, and the sooner that we recognize that the United States military, and therefore the United States government, is a terrorist organization that is and has been threatening the safety of the world for generations, the better. Trying to convince people of the threat that the United States poses to the world has not been easy. Who wants to admit that their government is a terrorist organization? But a simple look at history, as well as recent events, and it becomes clear that the United States is a literal terrorist organization. While radical Islam of course plays a role in terrorism, and many of the terrorist groups in the world are indeed radical Islamic groups, in many ways, their actions are the consequence of decades of imperialism in the greater Middle East (GME). Moreover, these actions are causing further radicalization. Origins of Western Intervention The manipulation of the GME by the United States dates back to the Cold War. At the time, the Soviet Union was looking to assert its own influence in the region. Because of the opposition to theism by the USSR, secular and anti-theist regimes were promoted over religious ones. To counter the growing affiliation between GME regimes and the USSR, the United States began supporting local rebel groups, which were often connected to fundamentalist Islamic views. The bulk of these operations in the United States were conducted by the CIA under Operation Cyclone . Under this program, the United States government literally helped to created the Taliban. They organized the Mujaheddin in order to fight off the Soviets who were trying to exert their own influence Afghanistan and surrounding regions. The CIA provided these rebels with millions upon millions of dollars. Indeed, at the time, United States propaganda whole heatedly depicted the Mujaheddin as a group of “freedom fighters.” Indeed, Rambo III was largely a propaganda piece which promoted the Mujaheddin. So in many ways, the issues of Islamic terrorism that the US faces today are a product of US activities in the region in the first place. But there’s another way in which the United States is fueling Islamic terrorism. US Terrorism and Imperialism Understanding double tap drone strikes is key to recognizing the United States for what it is. The double tap, in its general form, is a commonly used tactic by terrorist organizations. The goal is to strike a region once, and then wait. This pause gives time for first responders to rush to the scene to provide help. It’s at that point that a second attack is conducted, injuring or killing the first responders. This tactic is designed to increase civilization casualties and terrorize people so that they do not provide medical aid in the future. Unfortunately the United States has repeatedly utilized this kind of attack against other nations. Indeed, estimates from 2012 suggested that just one out of every fifty people killed by drone attacks were known militants . That leaves another 49 out of 50, many of them innocents. What’s also important to understand is that these attacks are not rogue operations. An analysis published in the Florida Law Review looked at numerous attacks by the US government. Among other conclusions, the report concluded the following. “the U.S. policy of assuming that all military-age males in the vicinity of a drone strike are militants unless proven otherwise posthumously directly contradicts the standard under intentional law, namely that individuals are presumed to be civilians unless.” The use of this style of attack is part of U.S. military policy. The article also concludes that while the nature of those being attacked can be determined within a reasonable degree of certainty with primary attacks, secondary and tertiary attacks make such determination next to impossible. So, I’m hoping that it is now apparent as to why double tap drone strikes are indeed acts of terror. And I hope that it is also apparent why the United States government itself is a terrorist organization. Overall, the United States, and allied forces, have been manipulating and attacking the greater Middle East for generations. There is constant activity to destabilize the region. And as a result, there’s a lot of radicalism. So contrary to popular belief, while radical Islam is a problem, it is primarily a result rather than the root cause. Radical Islam is a banner under which people have gathered to respond to US and western led imperialism of the region. And if we want to defeat radical Islam, we must end US imperialism. < Master Index | Cultural Politics | Further Reading The US Dollar is one of the Worst Sh*tcoins of Them All The ugly truth about the $USD medium.com
title_html: Radical Islam, Middle East Turmoil, and United States Led Imperialism
html:
Homepage
Homepage
Sign inGet started

Radical Islam, Middle East Turmoil, and United States Led Imperialism

Is radical Islam the cause or is it a consequence of a larger problem?

Daniel Goldman
Apr 19

Radical Islam has caused significant harm to the world. The worst terrorist organizations in the world are radical terrorist groups like the Taliban, Al Qaeda, ISIS, and so many others. They are responsible for countless lives being lost. Sorry, that’s actually the United States and allied forces, and the sooner that we recognize that the United States military, and therefore the United States government, is a terrorist organization that is and has been threatening the safety of the world for generations, the better.

Trying to convince people of the threat that the United States poses to the world has not been easy. Who wants to admit that their government is a terrorist organization? But a simple look at history, as well as recent events, and it becomes clear that the United States is a literal terrorist organization.

While radical Islam of course plays a role in terrorism, and many of the terrorist groups in the world are indeed radical Islamic groups, in many ways, their actions are the consequence of decades of imperialism in the greater Middle East (GME). Moreover, these actions are causing further radicalization.

Origins of Western Intervention

The manipulation of the GME by the United States dates back to the Cold War. At the time, the Soviet Union was looking to assert its own influence in the region. Because of the opposition to theism by the USSR, secular and anti-theist regimes were promoted over religious ones. To counter the growing affiliation between GME regimes and the USSR, the United States began supporting local rebel groups, which were often connected to fundamentalist Islamic views.

The bulk of these operations in the United States were conducted by the CIA under Operation Cyclone. Under this program, the United States government literally helped to created the Taliban. They organized the Mujaheddin in order to fight off the Soviets who were trying to exert their own influence Afghanistan and surrounding regions. The CIA provided these rebels with millions upon millions of dollars. Indeed, at the time, United States propaganda whole heatedly depicted the Mujaheddin as a group of “freedom fighters.” Indeed, Rambo III was largely a propaganda piece which promoted the Mujaheddin.

So in many ways, the issues of Islamic terrorism that the US faces today are a product of US activities in the region in the first place. But there’s another way in which the United States is fueling Islamic terrorism.

US Terrorism and Imperialism

Understanding double tap drone strikes is key to recognizing the United States for what it is. The double tap, in its general form, is a commonly used tactic by terrorist organizations. The goal is to strike a region once, and then wait. This pause gives time for first responders to rush to the scene to provide help. It’s at that point that a second attack is conducted, injuring or killing the first responders. This tactic is designed to increase civilization casualties and terrorize people so that they do not provide medical aid in the future.

Unfortunately the United States has repeatedly utilized this kind of attack against other nations. Indeed, estimates from 2012 suggested that just one out of every fifty people killed by drone attacks were known militants. That leaves another 49 out of 50, many of them innocents.

What’s also important to understand is that these attacks are not rogue operations. An analysis published in the Florida Law Review looked at numerous attacks by the US government. Among other conclusions, the report concluded the following. “the U.S. policy of assuming that all military-age males in the vicinity of a drone strike are militants unless proven otherwise posthumously directly contradicts the standard under intentional law, namely that individuals are presumed to be civilians unless.”

The use of this style of attack is part of U.S. military policy. The article also concludes that while the nature of those being attacked can be determined within a reasonable degree of certainty with primary attacks, secondary and tertiary attacks make such determination next to impossible. So, I’m hoping that it is now apparent as to why double tap drone strikes are indeed acts of terror. And I hope that it is also apparent why the United States government itself is a terrorist organization.

Overall, the United States, and allied forces, have been manipulating and attacking the greater Middle East for generations. There is constant activity to destabilize the region. And as a result, there’s a lot of radicalism. So contrary to popular belief, while radical Islam is a problem, it is primarily a result rather than the root cause. Radical Islam is a banner under which people have gathered to respond to US and western led imperialism of the region. And if we want to defeat radical Islam, we must end US imperialism.

< Master Index|Cultural Politics|
